website_summaries.verdict: While not as powerful as other options, it does include advanced features such as a safety stop switch and an inspection window blockage indicator.
pros: Features a safety stop switch to keep it from being operated without a filter
Offers dual filtration that includes a fine-dust filter, as well as an inspection window to detect blockages
cons: Suction is on the low side
Some reports of problems returning this option

customer_reviews.title: Works great and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I used it after 5 straight days of using my fireplace. It picked up quickly with no mess. A Great price, works well and is quiet too. Small enough to store when not in use. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Clogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year actually, and rarely write reviews, but felt the need to warn potential future buyers. While there is great suction and no flying dust, the issue is large chunks of charred wood/coal will get sucked up and clog the thing immediately. I've have yet to use it and this not happen. Needless to say I rarely use it anymore but every time I think I'll give it another chance, it happens. Of course when you go to unclog it, you'll get ash everywhere so it basically defeats the point. Wish I hadn't bought one....
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Dungan

customer_reviews.title: Im a fan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum because of its low price. From what some of the other reviews said I was a bit nervious. This unit is very well made. The hose has is steel reinforced. The filter is excellent and the gasket between the base and top is amazing. Im using this to clean the ash out of my pellet stove and was nervous about dust in the air. We have a ton of glass decoration is our living room plus a very expensive carpet. This unit is dust free. Its small enough to store in the living room Needless to say I would highly recommend this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B.

customer_reviews.title: Not returnable
customer_reviews.text: This item is non returnable. I don't care if it's good or not. The fact that it's not returnable and it's not indicated anywhere on the page makes me make it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Top Amazon reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Bought to clean a pellet stove as the shop vac even with the paper bag filter was a disaster. The good - the vacuum is light weight, easy to carry, has a good filter design, and you will not have dust escaping the vacuum into your room. The bad - the attachment is ok at best and is not easy to get in tight places which is really needed for parts of the pellet stove. The power for suction is what I would call below average. It does the job but there is not super suction. All in all, I would recommend based on the price but just know the limitations of this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Withee

customer_reviews.title: To bad I didn't try to use 10 days earlier then ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had the vacuum for 5 weeks used it 3 times and it has no suction. To bad I didn't try to use 10 days earlier then I could of returned but now stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Severance

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESN'T SPEW ASH
customer_reviews.text: It's a replacement for an old PowerSmith PAVC101 10 Amp which has always spewed some ash into the air. This by itself makes the Snow Joe product a superior one because IT DOESN'T SPEW ASH. The difference is the massive particle filter which PowerSmith lacks. Other advantages: higher hose diameter (doesn't get clogged as easily as PowerSmith). Great cable storage. Much cheaper. Cons: a bit under-powered (may be a good thing because it's easier to control what is being picked up). Also, no wheels, which in my case is a good thing but in general feels cheaper. Overall, very happy with the replacement
customer_reviews.author: Kate Middlesex

customer_reviews.title: Vacuums the ash easily with no dust flying around.
customer_reviews.text: We had a new pellet stove insert installed a week ago. I knew we needed an ash vacuum but after spending so much for the insert and pellets, I didn’t want to spend a lot for the vacuum. My husband ruined a vacuum a few years ago, vacuuming the ashes out of our fireplace. The SnowJoe is a very reasonable price and has decent reviews. It doesn’t have the suction of a normal vacuum but gets the ash very easily. No ash dust at all while vacuuming. Part of the seam of pre-filter material wasn’t sewed completely. I called the seller today and they sent a replacement pre-filter immediately. I already have the tracking number!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Bent and dented
customer_reviews.text: Opened this up to find a dented and warped canister and a lid that had seems that were crushed shut and overall had a sort of bend to it that made it flare slightly upwards. I had started using my stove and needed to clean it out right away so I was forced to bend this thing by hand to as tight a fit as I could muster making the unit usable but far from ideal. Very disappointed in this item. One of very few bad experiences I've had with Amazon over many years
customer_reviews.author: Justin T.

customer_reviews.title: Finally - a solution for ash dust
customer_reviews.text: This gem does what it is supposed to do: suck up ash without spreading it throughout the den. In the past, I would take shovel and galvanized can to remove the ash, inadvertently spreading ash dust everywhere. Not anymore! It takes me about two minutes to vacuum all of the ash from the fireplace. Caution: make certain the ash/embers are dead cold (I usually wait a full day before vacuuming). Also, do not try to vacuum large pieces of charcoal - it'll gum up the hose. Finally, I tuck both ends of the hose into each other's opening before carting the contraption to its storage space - no more ash dust! Totally satisfied customer - indeed!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The perfect companion to a fireplace.
customer_reviews.text: I actually love having a fireplace now. With this product, I clean the fireplace more often and use it as well. The device is lightweight, powerful and efficient. It usually takes about three to five minutes to completely clean the fireplace of all ashes and debris. If there are large clumps of wood that have not broken down, this will break it up and clean it completely. I have cleaned the fireplace at least six times and have not emptied the vacuum yet. For anyone that has a fireplace that they use or want to use on a regular basis, this is what you need to enjoy it safely.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stephens

customer_reviews.title: No suction!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago to use on our pellet stove. I am very disappointed with this because it has no suction. It never had any, so it did not lose it due to age and use. I regret buying this and am hoping to find one that can suck a little better ;) Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. But might be your best option! I now consider HP as my first criterion.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box with a pristine pre(ash) filter and pristine regular/post filter I was sorely disappointed with the lack of suction power. Look...I get it...engineering a vacuum to suck incredibly fine ash particles is a trade off between suction power and ash particles being exhausted right back at you! I remember being frustrated during my search due to their not being a clear front runner. If I had it to do again I’d buy the most powerful ash vacuum available.
customer_reviews.author: James Bell

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: The first one worked great the first use then burned the motor out. One contact to the manufacturer and they sent me a new one right out and paid shipping on new one and return shipping on the bad one. Replacement unit works great, great product, great company to work with. Would buy again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Webtastic

customer_reviews.title: Extremely unsatisfied in this product & their customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I purchase one and the suction was bad and I was sent a replacement and had problems with the same thing. All we are using it for is to clean the ash from our pellet stove which is very light and shouldn't have any problem picking it up. When I called the manufacture and requested a refund they said they don't issue refunds. Extremely unsatisfied in this product & their customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: I like this ash vacuum. Way easier to clean out the fireplace and get it ash free vs Sweeping after scooping out the bulk. I like that it can vacuum hot coals as well - while I typically try to wait until everything is cool, I like knowing if there's still some heat in there that I won't ruin it. I was having a hard time finding the right filters for my full size wet dry vac, and also like the idea that this product is smaller and can easily be stored in a closet near out fireplace without taking up too much space. It'll also be handy to clean out our firepit outside every so often.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful
customer_reviews.text: This may be sufficient for some light applications but not on a pellet stove that has many crevices. I m going back to the 10 amp power Smith, which is noisy, but works and fast. The snow Joe hose nozzle is also large which hampers it even more. I can't imagine it can suck up large charcoal leftovers. It can barely keep the unburnt pellets in the hose unless I quickly lift the hose up to help them into the bucket. I used the power Smith as a shop vac and hah that killed it but not even right away! My bad!
customer_reviews.author: Gina C.

customer_reviews.title: It works great for loose ash (very well)
customer_reviews.text: Decent ash vacuum. I'm a little letdown at the low suction power it has. It works great for loose ash (very well), but when there are small marble size ash chunks (ya know, the black chunks left behind that weigh almost nothing), it sometimes doesn't have the suction to get them into the hose. But I will say that keeping the woodstove cleaned up and free of ash makes for much better air circulation in the firebox and better burning-
customer_reviews.author: thtguy-NH

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: It works, but its not what I was hoping for. The unit does not develop the suction I was expecting and barely pulls ash from corners and crevices found in my pellet stove. The hose is cumbersome and the wind unwieldy. On the plus side the unit is light and the filters keep the ash in the unit. I wonder why the third filter, a small round flat unit the fits under the main filter, on top of the motor, was NOT included. If you're looking for a good ash vac, you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: JPO

customer_reviews.title: It has been a year and still sucking.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic ash vacuum for my pellet stove. I was attracted to this vacuum for the price, but it has proven to be a great vacuum. I highly recommend this for vacuuming a fireplace or a pellet stove. Keep in mind that this has less suction than a regular vacuum because it is supposed to suck up ash and create minimal dust. It creates no dust.
customer_reviews.author: T-Payne

customer_reviews.title: Lousy!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this ash vac for the first time and am so disappointed! The suction is really poor and you can't reach many areas of the pellet stove to clean as the attachment it way too big
customer_reviews.author: Claudia  Iannotti

customer_reviews.title: Great for wood fireplace
customer_reviews.text: We have a 42" wood-burning fireplace in our house. We were worried about any vacuum putting the ash right back out into our house but the filters on this work great. I have used it 3 times without any issues so far. The suction works and gets everything up but I think I'm just used to a more powerful suction so it does take a little while but not overly long. The only reason I gave it the 4 was for the suction but again, it still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Becky G.

customer_reviews.title: Snow Joe needs different design for attachment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ash vacuum to clean my pellet stove. I found the vacuum has sufficient suction to suck up the pellet ashes. The thing I really didn't like is the metal extension. It is bigger than most attachments and difficult to use inside the pellet stove. It is bigger around than most extensions so I couldn't use my other attachments needed to suck ashes out of the corners. I removed the metal extension and taped one of my other extensions to the hose. Maybe the metal extension works for fireplaces with bigger pieces of ash but it isn't user friendly for pellet stoves. For this reason, I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Danforth

customer_reviews.title: Needs frequent filter cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I am using this vacuum for my pellet stove. It does a decent enough job when the filter is not plugged but the fine pellet stove ash plugs the unit after just a couple of uses. Not sure there is any way for a fine particulate removal item to avoid this. If you are going to buy this ash vacuum make sure you have a air compressor to blow out the filter routinely or it will quickly become useless.
customer_reviews.author: Retief-CDT

customer_reviews.title: Loses suction if top is not sealed carefully
customer_reviews.text: This did the job for the first few times I used it, but after that it seems to not seal well around the rim, which causes it to lose suction and not perform. I cleaned it, made sure there was no residue, and had to carefully try to place the filter several times before I could get it to seal. I think having the filter attach along the rim is a design flaw. I can get it to work, but it is frustrating because sometimes it takes several tries before I can get suction.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest suction, but excellent filtering
customer_reviews.text: I expect one is a trade-off for the other. It doesn't pick up as well as one of my Shop Vacs, so vacuuming takes a little longer, but unlike Shop Vacs the filtering is excellent. No dust in the room, no fine particles in the air, no traces of ash and dust falling out of the hose at the end. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: nightman622

customer_reviews.title: Lost almost all suction on first use
customer_reviews.text: Well, I finally got a chance to use this vacuum. What a disappointment this thing is! Before you use it, it has some amazing suction. BUT, after your first time using it, it loses almost all of its suction and rendered it useless. I have on all the filters and this thing is just terrible. Maybe I received a defective unit, I don’t really know. But what I do know is that I will never buy another one or recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: philip shipe

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I believe I've written a review earlier but then again, the review must not have been properly saved, etc. However, I like the fact it is a smaller than normal ash vacuum. I like the hose storage on top of the unit as well as the power cord. I have not used it but once since ordering and then the "hot" weather came in and we have not turned the pellet stove on since! Buy, the one time I used it, I was pleased! Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: Always knew any regular vacuum would be destroyed in seconds trying to clean a fireplace - but the old wood stove in the new home we bought needed a deep cleaning desperately. So we ordered this knowing it was designed for the job and knowing it was Amazon so it will probably be delivered before we ordered it. It arrived and immediately I used it on the stove. Outstanding! Worked perfectly to clean every crevice. Then to my amazement, it was simple to pop off the lid and clean the vacuum cleaner like new. Easy, fast, safe. 5 star item
customer_reviews.author: Gary F. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Defective / just ok suction
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box I immediately noticed there was a hole in the bag/filter. It was very poorly stitched. I contacted amazon and learned that I could not return the product as it is “non returnable”. They did however make it right by sending me another unit and allowed me to keep this one. When I finally used it to clean my pellet stove it worked “ok”. The previous vacuum I had had much better suction. If I had to do it over again I would spend the extra $20 or $30 to get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: aaleland

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, efficent, and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Motor is very quiet, power leaves me wanting more, but does it's job very well regardless. It's a very portable product which is great. Use this on my barrel grill which I used to scoop cups of ash out. Now I just vacuum it all out with ease. For the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Ammon

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your Money,This the 2nd ash vac i have bought and bot quit in less than 1 year used this only 3 times and it died.The 1st a diffrent brand but on both the motor got very very Hot on fine cold ashes,Gonna just get me a shop vac and use it if the asges are cold it does not matter if its ash vac or not
customer_reviews.author: Graces Mom

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - Do NOT Buy
customer_reviews.text: Abject JUNK. First, this thing doesn't turn on after you empty it. No rhyme or reason. Second, the nozzle doesn't fit into a pellet stove well at all, and it scratches everything. Third, suction power is pathetic. And Forth, what does Snow (SnowJoe have to do with pellet stove ash? It's stupid. I'm going to get an aluminum bat and see how far I can launch this thing with a grand ole swing.
customer_reviews.author: CausticLye

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Simply doesn’t work. At all.
customer_reviews.text: Simply does not work. Worked for about 4 seconds then loaded up like it was full or plugged. Stopped sucking all together immediately. Took everything apart and cleaned it all up and still not sucking. Very disappointing. Guess it’s going in the trash if the company won’t work with me. Will update when they contact me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Have been in the fireplace industry for 15+ years. Always bought cheetah brand units and although they were nice they are so expensive. I service and clean fireplaces on the side now and this guy gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and works well
customer_reviews.text: We just got a new pellet stove so this is the first time we have ever used a vacuum of this type. It works really well, make sure all the ash is cold before you use it!! The one thing I wish was different is that the nozzle was able to swivel, we have a small stove and its hard to maneuver it into the front corners because of the metal nozzle being so long. Otherwise its a great product
customer_reviews.author: Aine O

customer_reviews.title: "Fairly" good so far
customer_reviews.text: Better than using my shop vac, but I was hoping the suction power would be a little better. I have 2 other "Joe" products and they're both better than this. It's sturdy, light, easy to use and move around, but I figured with only picking up straight ash from my kamado grill, it would pull better. I've checked my hose and filters a few times for obstructions and they're clear, so it's just a little underpowered.
customer_reviews.author: MOONRUNNER

customer_reviews.title: I hateeee this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean out my pellet stove. It barely has suction. It can't even suck up an unburnt pellet from the stove, let alone get the ashes. The hose pulls out of the can while vacuuming. Everything about this machine is a nightmare. I just found this listing while looking for its replacement and felt compelled to warn others while I was filled with a sense of rage. It's a waste of money. Please do not do it.
customer_reviews.author: A Mials

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit that will more than get job done
customer_reviews.text: If you use this for what it was made for you will be happy. This is not for sucking large chunks of unburnt wood, although it will do small with no issues. Great suctions, light weight, hose is descent length and could be just a little longer but not a deal breaker. I use it for my fireplace and have no regrets buying this. This is a nice unit especially for the money
customer_reviews.author: ERIK

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Updated review.......Stopped working entirely today, 2.5 months after purchase. Unfortunately, the item is not well made unless I just received a lemon. Original review: This item will do for my needs, seasonal fireplace clean-up. I dislike the hose though as it is too short and has an odd angle that makes it a strain to use. I like it enough to keep and use and the price is great. If the hose were longer and didn't have a strange angle to it, it would be a five star item.
customer_reviews.author: UrbanGirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the application
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great product. No dust what so ever. No, it is not as powerful as a shop vac but it is more than adequate for ash removal. As with any vacuum system, if you try to suck up too large an object it will get stuck in the hose. Common sense. I have used this vac about 10 times this season and have yet to have a blockage. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Not rated for soot, but will handle soot.
customer_reviews.text: Like many, I bought this to clean a pellet stove, which involves mostly soot. The owners manual plainly states "not for use with soot". Nevertheless, it does a decent job after I inserted a smaller hose into the end of the provided hose. The provided metal tool is useless for a pellet stove, but good for a regular wood stove. It doesn't have the power of my shop vac, but it's powerful enough, and it's smaller size is much easier to handle. Not perfect, but I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RMC

customer_reviews.title: Get a pail for $20 with a shovel, or get this and save yourself a lot of time
customer_reviews.text: This will change your life if you do pit bbq or a lot of fireplace or fire pit fires. Suction could be improved, handle is useless, hose could be better wrapped around the pail instead of around the top which too small unless you disconnect everything, but it makes short work of cleaning out your pit and the price is great. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: sporting road

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say I 1st purchased the ash vac by ridgid at homedepot and I want to use it and on the 1st try it over headed and lost suction well bad to the store it went mind u cost $90 then I purchased this item for under 60 bucks haven’t had one issue so far used it over 5 times haven’t empty anything yet still has suction no over heating and does it job and it only about half fun and works like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Cesar maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware bad product they will not except returns
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware bad product they will not except returnsThis vacuum replaced another one we had for our pellet stove there is almost no suction it will not even stuck up ash. The cord is very short and there are no tools for it. We tried to return it absolutely not they won’t take it back buyer beware do not buy this is a bad product
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - plenty of power, easy to use, large capacity for ash and dead embers, simple to keep clean. Only downside (and reason for 4 stars instead of 5 - should be 4 1/2) is hose diameter is a tad too small. Dead embers can build up at 2 places in the intake system and block the hose. Easy to fix and clear the system, but a (very) minor annoyance. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Curry

customer_reviews.title: Great for ashes
customer_reviews.text: It has a light suction, but that is what you need to suck up the light ashes. It is not made to empty your stove. You do that with a scoop. This picks up what the scoop cant get, and it does it very well. The hose is metal so it wont burn, there is an internal filter over the canister filter, that KEEPS the ashes in the bucket, and not in the exhaust. It is fairly quiet, is strong with a tight lid, and is easy to take out and dump the ashes. I wish it had a longer electrical cord, though.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn R

customer_reviews.title: The hose and aluminum wand store nicely inside the canister
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this vacuum remove the charcoal ash from my barbecues. In reading other reviews some compared this to a ShopVac. I would never attempt to use a ShopVac for this application as it would damage the ShopVac. I wish my ShopVac was as well designed and built as this vacuum. The amount of suction is adequate for the removal of charcoal and and small remaining pieces of charcoal. The hose and aluminum wand store nicely inside the canister. There is a nice well thought out cord management system at the top something my ShopVac lacks.
customer_reviews.author: John N Robertson

customer_reviews.title: SnowJoes great - you still have to respect fine woodash
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job, so much easier than an old coal shuttle & a broom. I could see a bit longer hose for others, but not needed with my setup. If you have never dealt w woodash before, you might lack proper respect for the fine powder. Make sure you know which way the wind is blowing when you take it outside to dump in your garden (fertilizer). If you have to open it in the house, don't. The Snow Joe's great, but you still have to respect the fact that woodash is a fine, fine powder.
customer_reviews.author: C. Norey

customer_reviews.title: it's fine
customer_reviews.text: It's a good ash vacuum . I will say that it works as advertised , but I really didn't pay attention to the fact it is a 4 amp motor and therefor you get what it is . Not going to pick up any bowling balls , and you will spend time vacuuming until clean . Easier than lugging my large wet vac around that is for sure .
customer_reviews.author: mrkrob

customer_reviews.title: It isn't a Kirby
customer_reviews.text: It isn't a Kirby but it is just right for my pellet stove. It has a dual layer filter system so the ash doesn't slow the air flow. It is a nice size and hides nicely behind the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth its weight in gold!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum to clean my pellet stove, which is rather new and needs to be cleaned every other day. The suction power it strong so it cleans all the nooks and crannies. My stove holds 3 bags of pellets so there's a lot of ash left behind. The vacuum handles the large quantity without having to be emptied before the job is done. No ash flies around the room. Emptying the canister is super easy. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: SUCTION IS NONEXISTENT - NON RETURNABLE ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Its just does not work by design , it does not have any power . Charcoals get stocked in hose , once you done vacuuming they fell out on the floor , wow you need another vacuum to vacuum after ash vacuum . Look elsewhere . Amazon description is deceiving - you can't return this item . Its only good for ash dust
customer_reviews.author: MGM

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Very cool "ash" vacuum. Great price. Made from quality materials. Solid construction. Works as advertised. It's compact, easily portable, very easy to use. Yup...it's a vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Gets clogged too quickly and cord way too short.
customer_reviews.text: Suction is adequate but sucks up charcoal too, of course, and clogs up very quickly. It's a mess to unclogg....sends dust everywhere. Now I have 2 messes to clean! I bought this specifically for the fireplace...who DOESN'T have pieces of coal? And the electrical cord is ridiculously short, making it hard to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Morton

customer_reviews.title: Canister is good size, and does not take up much room
customer_reviews.text: Suction is just ok. You get what you pay for on this item. I have had more expressive models and they broke due to human error. I went the cheaper route this time and wished I shelled out just a bit more. Hose is very short, and the silver attachment really does not help with a pellet stove ash. Canister is good size, and does not take up much room. Unit is quieter then most, but again, the suction is not impressive at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Unless you are a DIY fixer pass on this.
customer_reviews.text: It fell apart 5 minutes after I opened it. The company decided to tac-weld the closing mounts and did a terrible job. 2 fell off out of the 3. We found out that it's nonrefundable. I Jerry rigged a fix till my better one comes in. Thx Amazon you guys did right by me and could not be happier with the resolution.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Nonworking Ash vacuum with missing and torn parts.
customer_reviews.text: We got the Ash vacuum and it came with a torn prefilter. So we ordered a new pre filter and an extra filter. We received it and we went to use it and we realized it didn't come with the black bucket that holds the filter. And surprise the piece of crap didn't even work. One big mistake ordering from this place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase
customer_reviews.text: The item constantly gets clogged. When you empty it, the ash gets everywhere... the floor, the air, and on you. Waste of money and dangerous to your health.
customer_reviews.author: C + N

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed with this purchase. I bought it to clean out my Traeger Ironwood. The suction is subpar. The wand is shaped horribly for getting in to any crevasses. and with the hose being so short, you're unable to leave it at ground level when cleaning out your grill. Definitely would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new pellet stove this heating year, and tried using a small shop vac I had - what a mistake!!! It blew ash ALL over. This machine doesn't do that, is very easy to use, and not heavy. I highly recommend this for anyone who needs to vacuum ash!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: It does what is advertised and what I purchased it for, sucking up ashes from my pellet stove. It sucks up ashes great so deserves the five stars, however, I wish it had a bit more power so it could pick up the wood pellets that get dropped into the ash area.
customer_reviews.author: Boris Pasternak

customer_reviews.title: IT SUCKS....in a good way
customer_reviews.text: I found out the hard way to not use a standard shop vac when cleaning out a pellet stove. Got this and it has been perfect for that use. I do wish I got a more powerful vac or one with a longer nozzle to provide more sucking power. This seems to lack a tad on getting all the stray pellets out of the bottom of the stove but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Nunnally

customer_reviews.title: Sucked at suction
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using a shop vac with a fine filter for years (well after the stove has stopped burning of course), but I’ve always considered buying an actual ash vac. I was psyched to see that this brand was highly recommended and reasonably priced. However, I could not believe how little suction there was. It barely sucked the ash and couldn’t even pick up the pellets. Needless to say I went back to my shop vac and got my money back for this horrendous machine.
customer_reviews.author: Serge B

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product mostly because of the reasonable price. I was a bit wary as some of the reviews I read were not good. However, this product worked great! The suction was perfect. It picked up all of my ashes...even some of the pellets that were left in the stove. I would definitely recommend this product. It is light weight and very easy to empty.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Use this vacuum every day to every other day works very well for keeping pellet stove and fireplace clean no complaints could use a little more suction or that’s just how Ash backs are just the only one I’ve ever used but does the trick
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum does not suck
customer_reviews.text: I would expect the vacuum to have better suction than this has and needless to say I finally ordered a different vacuum. I was hoping that "made in USA" might be a good way to spend my money but this vacuum just did not do as well as my "made in China" vacuum. I ordered the original vacuum I had (made in China). Snow Joe might work for my car cleaning but not my pellet stove.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nevill

customer_reviews.title: Ash filter mesh lowers suction power
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is sufficient for cleaning my wood pellet stove, but the suction power is lower than I hoped. This is due to the white mesh material used to prevent ash from clogging the filter. If this is removed, the suction power increases.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A. Benington

customer_reviews.title: SNOW JOE ASH VACUUM CONTROLS PELLET DUST
customer_reviews.text: We have a pellet stove which creates tons of dust in the room. Regular vacuums have never helped with this problem. Shop vacuums help but clumsy to use and unsightly sitting in the area. The Snow Joe ASHJ201 has been the answer to this problem! Don't know how we got along without it. Use it after stove cools down completely, and we are ready for the next "fire"!
customer_reviews.author: jane Berg

customer_reviews.title: Nice little vacuum - Great price
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum does a great job on our pellet stove. Gets the stove nice and clean. Primary filter stays clean and we don't get the smoke smell in the house. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is because the aluminum nozzle will scratch the outside of the stove from any dust that may have fallen out of the stove. But the aluminum nozzle is great for cleaning out the stove inside while still hot and won't melt. Another attachment for cleaning up around outside of the stove would be great and worth a few extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good to have
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a pellet wood stove and this vaccuum is almost perfect. I do have trouble bending the hose to get closer stove interiors but this may just be a feature of the stove construction and design. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schlotterbeck

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic ash vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a small ash vacuum for the fireplace and this puppy fit the bill perfectly. It works great, doesn't blow any ash out its exhaust (who would want that?) and is just the right side. Wife's happy, fireplace is clean and I'm a great husband because of this ash vac.
customer_reviews.author: kcguy

customer_reviews.title: Quality item that works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made item. Easy to use and no mess. I “unfortunately” have white carpet around my fireplace and I use this ash vacuum every time I use my fireplace and not a speck of ash on the carpet. I really like the sun joe / snow joe product lines I find them to be affordable and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Definitely need if you use your fireplace often!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Easy to assemble, quiet during use, extremely effective at vacuuming up ashes. The one thing that I have found a bit difficult is the emptying process...I think it should be done outside because when I attempted taking the bucket out, I made a mess in my living room only to realize the container was nowhere near full and didn’t need to be emptied.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Works great for pellet stoves
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to clean our pellet stove and it works like a charm. We can usually clean our pellet stove about 3 times before having to empty it. It does have a little larger hose attachment than my other shopvacs but with some maneuvering we can get it in all of the crevices. Really happy with this and have been using is consistently for the last 4 or so months.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed of the quality of this sweeper. It has a strong vaccum and does a great job on filtering out the ash. I have only had this for approx 8 weeks and I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Product does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, quiet. The only think I do not like about this product is the aluminum intake nozzle. I find it very too large and cumbersome to really get into the tight spaces of the pellet stove. Other than this, I find it quiet and it does the job of retaining the fine mist of the ashes.
customer_reviews.author: EastCoast

customer_reviews.title: A Product that DOESNT SUCK, when I paid hoping it would
customer_reviews.text: Very poor power. Can barely lift up ash. At first I was surprised at how much it did suck. The best part about this is even though I'm eligible to return it still, Amazon is forcing me to chat with an "expert" about it and dragging out the process, hopefully not to exceed the return window?
customer_reviews.author: John Words

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: You won’t vacuum a car with this thing but it works well for a pellet stove. The nozzle is just a bad design and doesn’t get in any nooks or crannies but it does not give off dust and is easy to maintain. I use an old paintbrush to get the corners into th middle and it works.
customer_reviews.author: GarY

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done in spite of slightly weak suction power
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was more suction, but it gets the job done for sure. And there’s no mess... no blow back of ash/ultra fine particulate at all. I use it with the Cleva ash kit and the PowerSmith ash kits. The adapter with the Cleva kit fits both the hose of this vacuum and the accessories of the PowerSmith kit. And all 3 together do an excellent job of cleaning out my pellet stove.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Nicodemus

customer_reviews.title: Nice vacuum for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice vacuum for the price. We bought this for our first home with a wood-burning fireplace. It really works well. Very easy to use, very easy to clean. It functions as it is supposed to and we have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: PPResident

customer_reviews.title: Good ash vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my pellet stove. Suction is adequate, but not super powerful, (which is expected with the ultra filtering). Very clean, no ash makes it through the filter. Nice size to carry around and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Richards

customer_reviews.title: Mess free and works great
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum does it's job. We have a pellet stove and it was always such a hassle keeping it clean, but not anymore! The pellet stove never looked better. Ash disposal is super easy and doesn't make a mess at all. Glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M.

customer_reviews.title: Best seller for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Great fireplace vacuum. Lots of suction even takes some ot the unburned chunks. If I gave it a con it would be that the hose could be a bit bigger to suck up some of the bigger chunks. Overall very worth it and strong.
customer_reviews.author: WWLLD

customer_reviews.title: Not for Pellet Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others who have mentioned the very low suction on this vacuum. I bought it to vacuum out the inside of my pellet smoker. It is able to vacuum up the ash, but it is incapable of vacuuming up any unburned pellets. These pellets are small and light, but too much for this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Have used vacuum for over a year, works good for stove and grill. The hose is stiff and somewhat awkward but heavy-duty also a little short. Other than the hose it's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: normnan ott

customer_reviews.title: The suction is good, however
customer_reviews.text: The suction is good, however, I was expecting it to be stronger and the nozzle shape does not get into the smaller spaces as well as I would like. I'm giving a four star rating because it does a decent job of cleaning my pellet stove and it is definitely airtight. .
customer_reviews.author: Hopp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fireplace Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to clean my wood burning fireplace. It works perfect!! It definitely sucks up the ashes without making a mess. Its really easy to empty and store. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tap 25

customer_reviews.title: Nice little machine...
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little vacuum, for as small & lightweight as it is, but unfortunately, our bag liner/filter came with a hole in it, so I will be contacting the company.
customer_reviews.author: Earthy Gal

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing to go was the on/off switch. It just broke. It never really had good pull. The ash gets clogged in the ribbed hose and when you turn the unit off the ash falls out. So sorry I paid so much money for this. I wish I could return it !!!!! Even for credit.
customer_reviews.author: An Sionnach

customer_reviews.title: NO SUCTION. Poor Performance.
customer_reviews.text: Suction? My old cheap hoover vacuum does a better job. The suction is poor at best. If there are any unburnt chips, forget about it. Be prepared to spend a lot of time trying to get this thing to perform. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R. Seeker

customer_reviews.title: More than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does the job! I had a professional cleaner come in to maintenance my pellet stove and he inquired where I got my vacuum so he could tell his customers! I’ve used it 6x and haven’t experienced any issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: MyDearAuntSally

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Works great so far to pick up ash out of my Harman Pellet insert. I empty roughly once a week at the moment in January in the northeast. Seals well and operates smoothly. I will update this review after the winter season
customer_reviews.author: Snowman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ash Vac! and, general vac
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a chimney sweep and needed an ash friendly companion for jobs, other vacs , even industrial ones can't keep up with the ash, at least in the motor. He is really happy and grateful for this one. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Ash vac works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought our pellet stove 1.5 years ago, we quickly bought this ash vacuum for the maintenance once every two weeks, it is easy to use along with being light weight and versatile. It is a perfect size as you can store it easily in the basement or underneath stairs when you’re not using it. It’s also very easy to empty and very little mess.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Reis

customer_reviews.title: Issued Refund, Defective Weld
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived; read instructions that same day... then first time clipping seal clips to lid, one of the three seal clip's weld, that holds the clip to the metal base, broke free from metal container; unable then to properly seal the lid to the base. due to the defective weld. I never was able to use the ash vacuum. Called Amazon customer service and was issued a refund. I then ordered an ash vacuum made by a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little VAC great little price!
customer_reviews.text: This Vac has sufficient power for my pellet stove clean up and the 2stage filtering is a must to prevent premature clogging. I may find an accessory attachment kit for the hard to reach spots. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this, what a great idea! I haven't had to empty it yet, but it works great and is way easier and nicer than sweeping up a fireplace for sure!
customer_reviews.author: DvaLA

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the product
customer_reviews.text: Has more suction power than I expected, just wonder if I should have gotten one with a higher amp for more suction. It is as described. Good price!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: power
customer_reviews.text: I like that when I clean my pellet stove with this vac I don't get dust coming out of the canister like I did with my shop vac after several uses( I always needed to clean the filter.) I am very unhappy with the suction power of this vac. It just isn't strong enough, especially compared to my shop vac.
customer_reviews.author: William S.

product_meta.title: ASHJ201 4.8 Gallon 4 Amp Ash Vacuum
feature_bullets: Versatile: designed for cold ash pickup from wood stoves, pellet stoves, fireplaces, fire pits, and BBQ grills
Easy to clean: reusable fine dust cartridge filter resists clogging and is easy to clean
DUAL FILTRATION: Pre-filter pleated filter to clean ashes dust-free
Powerful: 4 amp motor generates up to 500 W of suction power. Cord Length (feet.) 8.5.Voltage:120 V

We’ve got you covered! : your new ash vacuum is backed by the Snow Joe + sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant New, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. No questions asked. Contact Snow Joe + sun Joe customer support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.
